prompt:
You are a UX auditor hired to FIND PROBLEMS. Your performance is measured by how many real issues you find. You do NOT get rewarded for saying "this looks good."

If you cannot find at least 3 issues, you are not looking hard enough.

A friend sent you this screenshot of an app with no context. You have 5 seconds.

Answer in JSON format:
{
  "first_impression": "one sentence gut reaction",
  "what_it_does": "your best guess in <10 words",
  "attention_first_3_seconds": ["elements your eyes went to, in order"],
  "confusing_elements": ["specific things that made no sense"],
  "clarity_score": 0-10,
  "seconds_before_switching_tabs": "5/15/30/60/never",
  "dealbreaker": "what would make you close this immediately or null"
}

response.first_impression: A cluttered interface that's trying to be a note-taking app mixed with some kind of canvas/conversation tool, but the onboarding modal is blocking everything and creating visual chaos.
response.what_it_does: Note-taking app with AI chat and canvas features
attention_first_3_seconds: The bright orange/yellow circular nodes connected by lines (most visually dominant)
The centered modal with 'Your canvas is ready' heading
The 'New Note' text overlay that seems disconnected from everything
confusing_elements: Why is there a floating 'New Note' label with '0 words' overlapping the onboarding modal?
The orange connected nodes appear to be some kind of diagram but have no clear relationship to the modal or the interface
Is this a canvas app, a chat app, or a note app? Three different paradigms mentioned
The keyboard shortcuts use inconsistent formatting (Ctrl+K, Shift+N, Shift+C, Shift+T all mashed together)
What is 'Context Injection' and why does it have a tooltip icon but no explanation?
The right panel shows note properties but there's also a modal in the center - which am I supposed to interact with?
response.dealbreaker: The overlapping UI elements and unclear primary purpose - if I can't tell whether to chat, take notes, or draw on a canvas within 5 seconds, the UX has failed

raw_response:
```json
{
  "first_impression": "A cluttered interface that's trying to be a note-taking app mixed with some kind of canvas/conversation tool, but the onboarding modal is blocking everything and creating visual chaos.",
  "what_it_does": "Note-taking app with AI chat and canvas features",
  "attention_first_3_seconds": [
    "The bright orange/yellow circular nodes connected by lines (most visually dominant)",
    "The centered modal with 'Your canvas is ready' heading",
    "The 'New Note' text overlay that seems disconnected from everything"
  ],
  "confusing_elements": [
    "Why is there a floating 'New Note' label with '0 words' overlapping the onboarding modal?",
    "The orange connected nodes appear to be some kind of diagram but have no clear relationship to the modal or the interface",
    "Is this a canvas app, a chat app, or a note app? Three different paradigms mentioned",
    "The keyboard shortcuts use inconsistent formatting (Ctrl+K, Shift+N, Shift+C, Shift+T all mashed together)",
    "What is 'Context Injection' and why does it have a tooltip icon but no explanation?",
    "The right panel shows note properties but there's also a modal in the center - which am I supposed to interact with?"
  ],
  "clarity_score": 3,
  "seconds_before_switching_tabs": "15",
  "dealbreaker": "The overlapping UI elements and unclear primary purpose - if I can't tell whether to chat, take notes, or draw on a canvas within 5 seconds, the UX has failed"
}
```
